1.text: I charge you therefore before God, and the Lord Jesus Christ, who shall judge the quick and the dead at his appearing and his kingdom;

2.text: Preach the word; be instant in season, out of season; reprove, rebuke, exhort with all long-suffering and doctrine.

3.text: For the time will come when they will not endure sound doctrine; but after their own lusts shall they heap to themselves teachers, having itching ears;

4.text: And they shall turn away their ears from the truth, and shall be turned to fables.

5.text: But watch you in all things, endure afflictions, do the work of an evangelist, make full proof of your ministry.

6.text: For I am now ready to be offered, and the time of my departure is at hand.

7.text: I have fought a good fight, I have finished my course, I have kept the faith:

8.text: From now on there is laid up for me a crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous judge, shall give me at that day: and not to me only, but to all them also that love his appearing.

9.text: Do your diligence to come shortly to me:

10.text: For Demas has forsaken me, having loved this present world, and is departed to Thessalonica; Crescens to Galatia, Titus to Dalmatia.

11.text: Only Luke is with me. Take Mark, and bring him with you: for he is profitable to me for the ministry.

12.text: And Tychicus have I sent to Ephesus.

13.text: The cloak that I left at Troas with Carpus, when you come, bring with you, and the books, but especially the parchments.

14.text: Alexander the coppersmith did me much evil: the Lord reward him according to his works:

15.text: Of whom be you ware also; for he has greatly withstood our words.

16.text: At my first answer no man stood with me, but all men forsook me: I pray God that it may not be laid to their charge.

17.text: Notwithstanding the Lord stood with me, and strengthened me; that by me the preaching might be fully known, and that all the Gentiles might hear: and I was delivered out of the mouth of the lion.

18.text: And the Lord shall deliver me from every evil work, and will preserve me to his heavenly kingdom: to whom be glory for ever and ever. Amen.

19.text: Salute Prisca and Aquila, and the household of Onesiphorus.

20.text: Erastus stayed at Corinth: but Trophimus have I left at Miletum sick.

21.text: Do your diligence to come before winter. Eubulus greets you, and Pudens, and Linus, and Claudia, and all the brothers.

22.text: The Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Grace be with you. Amen.
